title: Potential energy - conservation of mechanic energy

content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="2 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math> moves along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis while a net non-linear conservative force is exerted on it. The potential energy of the system consisting of the object as well as other objects is given by the graph. The speed of the object at <math alttext="x equals 1 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. Estimate the maximum speed of the object.

choices.label: <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of 5, end root, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times the square root of 3, end root, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times the square root of 3, end root, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
